alert.note: Alert for Baker; Bradford; Union; Western Clay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 8:21PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN BRADFORD... SOUTHEASTERN BAKER...NORTHEASTERN UNION AND WEST CENTRAL CLAY COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM EDT... At 820 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from near Camp Blanding to near Kingsley to near Starke. Movement was northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Starke, Raiford, Macclenny, Glen St. Mary, Sanderson, Camp Blanding, Kingsley, Lawtey, and Ellerbee. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
